intro: Ficaria ficariiformis, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form and its production of small, star-shaped flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. The flowers, which are typically yellow or orange, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
